JobTitle1: Prinicipal Business Development Manager, AWS for Data, EMEA Public Sector
Title: Unleash the Power of GenAI: Generate Growth and Innovation with Data
Abstract: Your data is the key to unlocking GenAI's true potential! This session dives deep into real-world GenAI use cases across various industries. We'll then explore how to optimize your data for these applications. Discover practical strategies to transform your data into the fuel that ignites GenAI's power.  Learn how to unlock fresh ideas, streamline processes, and achieve exceptional results – propelling your business forward with innovation and growth.

Title: Superposition in LLM Feature Representations
Abstract: Dive into the quantum realm of LLMs! Join me as we unravel the superposition in LLM feature representations, exploring the intersection of finance, technology, and AI interpretability. Unearth insights from my journey at Bloomberg, Palantir, and my pursuit of mechanistic interpretability.

Title: The Evolution of AI Models and LLMS in last 10 years
Abstract: Take a journey across the past decade, experiencing the astonishing progress of AI models and LLMs. Join me as we look at the revolutionary advances that have transformed sectors, from cutting-edge language models to the democratization of AI.

Title: Topic modeling for text documents using NLP techniques
Abstract: I am working to help process data at scale and to build AI capability that identifies duplicate funding applications and tags applications using topic modeling to identify current trends in innovation across. This capability has helped organizations set up AI capability and automate manual tagging.

Title: Vectoring Into The Future: AWS Empowered RAG Systems for LLMs
Abstract: Dive into AWS' innovative toolkit for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems. Harness the power of vector databases, SageMaker JumpStart, and/or BedRock to supercharge your Large Language Models (LLMs) and reshape your GenAI landscape!

Title: Running an open source LLM
Abstract: In this talk, we will explore the options available for harnessing LLMs, including deploying your own service or using existing LLM APIs. Attendees will learn best practices for leveraging LLMs effectively, whether by building or subscribing.

Title: AI Chats: What Nobody Told You - The Conundrums of Business Integration
Abstract: Explore the intricacies of integrating ChatGPT into business systems with data privacy challenges, cost implications, and the strategic analysis required for successful integration. Learn about direct API integration, cost optimization, and customizing privately hosted models to fit your resources and needs.

Title: Isolation levels and partial failures in distributed systems with LLMs
Abstract: Addressing isolation levels and partial failures in distributed systems with LLMs requires careful consideration of system architecture, fault tolerance mechanisms, and concurrency control strategies to ensure consistent and reliable operation despite the complexities of distributed environments.

JobTitle1: Head of International Business Development, New Markets Launch
Title: The Human Touch in AI-Driven Business Development: Striking the Right Balance
Abstract: Managing AI-driven business development necessitates finesse—balancing innovation with the timeless value of human connection. Join me as we investigate the balance between tech and the human touch, ensuring that our strategies complement rather than replace the personal element of business success.

Title: Implementing GenAI in a banking context: A hands-on approach
Abstract: Unlock business potential with LLMs! Learn strategic use case selection, navigate proprietary vs. external models, build a dynamic PoC team, deploy, refine with customer feedback, and scale success across cases. Embrace an agile, iterative development approach for impactful results.

Title: Governance, Risk, and Compliance for Large Language Models
Abstract: In a rush to implement GenAI for enterprise productivity, companies introduce new risks. An AI safety and security expert explains dozens of risks across the LLM lifecycle and business processes where LLMs are used. The audience will learn how to manage risks emerging from using AI applications.

Title: Adapting to Change: Navigating Market Shifts in the Tech Industry
Abstract: Embark on a journey through tech's ever-changing landscapes! Join me to explore dynamic strategies for navigating market shifts. Learn to identify trends, pivot strategies, and unearth case studies of companies thriving amidst change. Don't just adapt, thrive in the evolving tech industry!

Title: Product Management & Regulation: A Key Requirement or an MVP?
Abstract: Understand the impact regulations have on product managers through a specific real-life example of CASS 7.15 regulation by the FCA.

Title: Make your LLM app sane again: Forgetting incorrect data in real time
Abstract: In this talk, you will learn how to create an LLM-powered chatbot in Python from scratch with an up-to-date RAG mechanism. The chatbot will answer questions about your documents, updating its knowledge in real-time alongside the changes in the documentation, enabling the chatbot to filter out fake news.

Title: Building Chatbots with Advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation Techniques
Abstract: I will present how you can build realistic chatbots capable of handling authentic conversations using advanced retrieval augmented generation (RAG) techniques such as hybrid search, re-ranking, query generation, and semantic text chunking.

Title: How to use ChatGPT without getting caught
Abstract: Explore the detection of AI-generated text! Learn from scratch how AI text generation works. Discover classifier systems, black/white box models, watermarking, and manual techniques for detection. Uncover the tricks to bypass these systems by diving into the world of detection of AI-generated texts!

Title: LLM-Models: Revolutionizing Customer Support or Ringing its Death Knell?
Abstract: Join me to explore whether these models are the game-changers or potential disruptors, and gain insights into navigating this transformative landscape.

Title: LLM for better developer learning of your product
Abstract: Learn how an LLM app can solve key challenges in developer learning.

Title: You get an LLM, you get an LLM, everyone gets an LLM, but does it work?
Abstract: While everyone wants to say those magical words AI, LLM, have you evaluated your models to see if they actually work for you and your use case, or are you just using whatever's the most trending model out there? In this talk, we will explore the language models and evaluate those choices.

Title: How well do LLMs detect anomalies in your data?
Abstract: Bad data quality causes US companies to lose, on average, 12% of their revenue. In this talk, we will construct an anomaly detector, exploring LLMs, prompt engineering, and data type impacts. Along this path, we will analyze the use of multiple tools including OpenAI, BigQuery, and Mistral.

Title: Semi-Supervised Learning: How to overcome the lack of labels
Abstract: Prepare for an exciting journey into Semi-Supervised Learning. It uses minimal labeled data to guide the analysis of abundant unlabeled data, saving time and resources while maintaining accuracy. Perfect for AI applications in label-limited scenarios.

Title: A data-driven approach to Product Discovery
Abstract: Dive into the heartbeat of product discovery! Join me in unlocking the power of a data-driven approach. From Uber to Revolut, my journey unveils how strategic data insights can transform product road mapping. Let's amplify your discovery process with actionable data for innovation that resonates!

Title: How to develop framework for Real-Time RAG in LLM Applications
Abstract: This talk would focus on how to use RAGs in LLMs by applying the latest updates to the vector database in real-time. RAG can help add more context to the LLMs and can be a potent strategy to fine-tune LLM models and mitigate hallucinations.

Title: Large Action Models (LAMs)
Abstract: Unlock the future of AI with Large Action Models (LAMs)! Imagine language models evolving into intelligent agents, autonomously executing tasks in real-time. Dive into the realm of LAMs, revolutionizing healthcare, finance, automotive, and beyond. Join the journey at the forefront of AI innovation.

Title: Self-host LLMs on Mac/across devices: Fast and Efficient
Abstract: Fast and Portable Llama2 Inference on the Heterogeneous Edge: An alternative to Python. Compared with Python, Rust+Wasm apps could be 1/100 of the size, 100 times the speed, and, most importantly, securely run everywhere at full hardware acceleration without any change to the binary code.
Keywords: Self-host LLMs on Mac/across devices: Fast and Efficient

Title: Expertise in constructing extensive infrastructures and discerning their fundamental distinctions from smaller counterparts
Abstract: Explore the heart and soul of constructing vast infrastructures! Join me for a tech odyssey where scaling up isn’t just a challenge—it’s an art. Unveil the magic behind building big, with relatable stories and real-world lessons. Don’t miss the journey from small to colossal!

Title: Leveraging open-source LLMs for production
Abstract: This talk examines using open-source LLMs for real-world purposes. It compares the benefits and drawbacks of open-source LLMs to proprietary options like OpenAI. The discussion covers the economics of hosting open-source LLMs, highlights serving frameworks, and overviews key open-source LLMs.

Title: Applying LLMs in real PHP projects: Transform Your Code with Advanced AI
Abstract: Join an intriguing discussion on how the development of LLMs has influenced the PHP community and individual developers. We'll look at what tasks and difficulties you may encounter when integrating these tools into your project and outline methods for solving these issues.

Title: Automated Evaluation for your RAG Chatbot or Other Generative Tool
Abstract: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) chatbots and other generative tools that you want to build out for narrow use cases are software and can be tested like software. In this talk, I’ll discuss how to write automated evaluations of your tools by using LLMs to assess your LLM.

Title: Unleash GenAI while remaining cost-effective with serverless
Abstract: Discover how Serverless transforms the GenAI landscape! Learn to seamlessly integrate LLMs into any application, overcoming complex and costly workflows. Our talk unveils efficient orchestration strategies for LLM calls, ensuring smooth and cost-effective interactions between your code, users, and AI.

Title: Adding Generative AI to Real-Time Streaming Pipelines
Abstract: Let's build streaming pipelines that convert streaming events into prompts, call LLMs, and process the results.

JobTitle1: Data Science and Machine Learning Fellow
Title: Transforming Content Creation with Collaborative AI: A Groundbreaking Approach
Abstract: Discover a new paradigm in content creation: collaborative AI. Learn how leveraging multiple LLMs in an iterative feedback loop led to outputs surpassing the original human-created content—all in mere minutes. Unlock the transformative potential of collaborative AI to achieve content perfection.

Title: Large Language Models and Observability
Abstract: Explore the challenges of LLMs, such as output drift, model reliability, and explainability. Learn how traditional engineering observability can be adapted for AI using tools like GCP and Vertex AI. Gain actionable insights to make your AI applications more robust, accountable, and safe.

Title: LLMs in AWS: Observability Maturity from Foundation to AIOps
Abstract: Unleash Large Language Models in AWS! Join "AWS LLMs Observability: Foundation to AIOps" Boost LLM performance, troubleshoot precisely, stay ahead. Dive into a comprehensive maturity model for immediate impact, creating value for GenAI applications. Innovate now! Elevate your insights.

Title: Generative AI Security: A Practical Guide to Securing Your AI Application
Abstract: Generative AI brings both, great opportunities and new security challenges. This talk shows how to innovate with AI while protecting systems. Learn practical strategies to apply guardrails, ensure observability, evaluate security measures, and mitigate risks from ideation to production.

Title: Building our own LLM Vulnerability Scanner to audit and secure AI applications
Abstract: One of the practical techniques to secure self-hosted LLMs involves building a vulnerability scanner that checks for vulnerabilities such as prompt injection. In this session, we will discuss how to build a custom scanner to help teams identify security issues specific to their self-hosted LLMs.

Title: Leveraging Large Language Models in a Communication Platform
Abstract: Elevate your communication platform with heightened context, boosted productivity, and streamlined processes like Site Reliability Engineering and Change Management. Say goodbye to FOMO and stress, with a focus on security and ethics.

Title: Getting AI to Do the Unexpected
Abstract: The top three vulnerabilities with LLM apps currently are Prompt Injections, Insecure Output Handling, and PII data leakage. In this session, attendees will learn about these prompt hacking vulnerabilities, mitigation strategies, and the importance of 'secure by design' practices in LLM app development.

JobTitle1: Principal Architect - Platform Engineering, Global Financial Services
Title: Operational excellence for your LLMs using Amazon Bedrock
Abstract: Customers are looking for a turnkey solution to integrate LLMs with their existing applications. This session will provide an overview of the operational considerations, architectural patterns, and governance controls needed to operate LLMs at scale.

Title: Measuring hallucinations in RAG
Abstract: Developers building RAG applications want to overcome the inherent problem of hallucinations in LLMs. In this talk, I'll explain why hallucinations occur, how RAG supports them, and why the HHEM (Hallucination Evaluation Model) can help.

Title: The future of search
Abstract: Vector databases and semantic search have been around for a while, but the rise of LLMs opened up new horizons in the field of search. In this talk, we'll explore a project codenamed SeSeDB, which allows searching through databases, text, and documents using human language (any language and even images).

Title: Large Language Models is What We Need to Create Jarvis from Ironman
Abstract: Join Jason in an engaging session as he uncovers the transformation of sci-fi into reality using Large Language Models. Explore how LLMs are redefining software development, bringing us closer to the dream of a Jarvis-like AI. Prepare for a fascinating journey into the future of AI.

Title: Navigating the New Internet: LLMs as the Key to Web4 Transformation
Abstract: Explore how Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing the internet, from transforming UI designs to driving environmental efficiency. Join us to uncover the future of digital communication with LLMs leading the Web4 era.

JobTitle1: Associate Director - Data Science & Machine Learning
Title: Future of LLM's and Machine learning Productionization
Abstract: Unlock the future of LLMs and Machine Learning Productionization in my talk! Dive into the cutting-edge trends and transformative potential that will redefine how we use LLMs and implement machine learning at scale. Don't miss the chance to navigate the next frontier of AI innovation.
